explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_liquids.rationale: Flash point: >=23degC and <=60degC, UNRTDG Class: 3, PGIII

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Calculated based on the rat LD50 value: 1670mg/kg (ACGIH 7th, 2001, PATTY 4th, 1994), 2407mg/kg (PATTY 4th, 1994) and approximately 1600mg/kg (PATTY 4th, 1994). Since the calculation value was lower than 1600mg/kg which was the lowest value, 1600mg/kg was adopted to classify as category 4.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on rabbit LD50 value: 12.6mL/kg (PATTY 4th, 1994) (reduced values = 10300mg/kg), it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: There are the description that death was not observed with rat 4-hour inhalation exposure to 2000ppm (vapor with almost no mist from its vapor pressure) (PATTY (4th, 1994)), and that all 6 rats died from exposure to 4000ppm (vapor with almost no mist from its vapor pressure). By the ppm concentration standard, it was presupposed that it cannot be classified although it is considered to be either Category 3 or Category 4.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: There is the description that the all three rat died from 5100ppm (equivalent 23.8mg/L) within 4 hours in the inhalation exposure test (PATTY (4th, 1994)). But there is no other data. Therefore, it cannot be classified since data is insufficient for specifying category.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was set as Category 2 from description that the moderate irritation was admitted in the test applied to the skin of the rabbit for 24 hours (ACGIH (7th, 2001) and PATTY (4th, 1994)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Change of the eyes which corresponds to the standard of irritation was not admitted in the eye irritation tests using the rabbit (ECETOC TR48 (1992)). However, there is the description that slight irritation was acknowledged in the eyes of the rabbits (PATTY (4th, 1994)). So we classified it as Category 2B

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory organ: No data. Skin :Although there was description that it gave no positive reaction in the skin sensitivity test for humans in PATTY (4th, 1994), subjects of this small-scale test were 26 examples and since there was no other data, we presupposed that it is considered lack of data and we could not classify it.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation or may cause drowsiness and dizziness (respiratory tract irritation, narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Because of descriptions in ACGIH (7th, 2001) and PATTY (4th, 1994) referring to that respiratory irritant and anesthetic actions were confirmed in inhalation exposure tests using guinea pigs, and of a description in PATTY (4th, 1994) referring to confirmation of respiratory irritant and anesthetic actions (symptoms indicating effects on nervous systems) in an inhalation exposure test using rats, it was judged as Category 3 (respiratory irritation, anesthesia action).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the descriptions that no effect was observed with the concentration exceeding the guidance value range for Category 2 in the nine-month inhalation exposure test on rats (ACGIH (7th, 2001) and PATTY (4th, 1994)), and that no effect was observed with the dose exceeding the guidance value range for Category 2 in the repetitive oral administration test on rats (PATTY (4th, 1994)), it was classified as out of Category.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May be harmful if swallowed and enters airways
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Category 2 because of a ketone composed of 13 carbon atoms or less.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It carried out the outside of Category from 96-hour LC50=131mg/L of fishes (Fathead minnows) (HSDB, 2004).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since not water-insoluble (aqueous solubility =4300mg/L(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)) and acute toxicity is low.
